Prerequisites: PREREQUISITE(S): ACG 3113 WITH A MINIMUM GRADE OF C
Course Description: APPLICATION OF FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING AND AUDITING PRINCIPLES AND THEORY TO BOTH GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.  LEARN THE ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING CONCEPTS AND RULES 
OF GOVERNMENTAL UNITS AND THOSE OF ENTITIES CONTROLLED BY GOVERNMENTAL UNITS.
2. UNDERSTAND THE UNIQUE ROLE BUDGETING PLAYS IN GOVERNMENTAL OPERATIONS EXTERNAL REPORTS, INCLUDING 
ENTITY-WIDE REPORTS.
3. UNDERSTAND THE REASONS FOR THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN GOVERNMENTAL/NONPROFIT ACCOUNTING AND THAT OF PRIVATE ENTERPRISES.
4. UNDERSTAND THE ACCOUNTING 
AND REPORTING RULES OF NON-
GOVERNMENTAL NON-PROFIT 
ENTITIES.
5. UNDERSTAND THE AUDIT 
REQUIREMENTS FOR 
GOVERNMENTAL UNITS AND NON-
GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES.
6. DEVELOP AN ETHICAL AND 
PROFESSIONAL PERSPECTIVE 
TOWARDS GOVERNMENTAL 
ACCOUNTING.
Textbook(s): GOVERNMENT & NOT-FOR-PROFIT ACCOUNTING, 4TH ED., BY MICHAEL GRANOF WITH DISC.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
